fields.object_repr: (BCSE) Bachelor of Computer Science and Engineering at IUBAT— International University of Business Agriculture and Technology

fields.tag_line: I'm The Boss Here
Backend Developer | Web Developer | CSE Graduate
fields.about:
Hello! I’m Hassan, a passionate Python-Django Backend Developer with a knack for turning ideas into scalable, efficient systems. My journey in tech blends hardware tinkering (thanks to my love for electronics!) with software craftsmanship—whether it’s building web APIs or innovating data transmission methods like Li-Fi using RGB light.

What I Do
💻 Backend Development: Craft robust APIs and databases with Python, Django, and MySQL.

🔌 Hardware Hacks: Experiment with Arduino, sensors, and IoT projects (like my thesis on parallel Li-Fi data transmission).

🌐 Problem-Solver: From ISP management systems to optimizing data transfer rates, I thrive on challenges.

My Journey
A Computer Science graduate (B.Sc, CGPA: 3.42), I’ve balanced academia with hands-on projects—like developing a PHP/MySQL ISP Management System and pushing boundaries in Li-Fi research. Now, I’m focused on mastering Django REST Framework and cloud technologies to build even faster, smarter backends.

Beyond Code
When I’m not debugging, you’ll find me:

🎨 Sketching or crafting (a holdover from my art school days!).

🎤 Public speaking—I love sharing tech insights.

🤖 Building robots (because why not?).

Let’s connect! I’m always open to collaborations or chats about tech, innovation, or your next big idea.
fields.meta_description: Abdullah Md Jahid Hassan – A Python-Django backend developer passionate about scalable web solutions, with experience in software engineering, electronics, and Li-Fi research. View my projects, thesis, and internship highlights.

fields.title: Internet Service Provider Management System
fields.tag_line: Web-based ISP management system with role-based access and payment tracking.
fields.description:
🛜 Project Name: Internet Service Provider Management System
🔗 GitHub Repository:
https://github.com/abdullah-md-jahid-hassan/Internet-Service-Provider


🔗 Live On:
https://www.isp.amjh.space


🔎 Overview:
This project is a powerful web-based platform designed to streamline operations for ISPs. From managing customers and employees to handling payments and service assignments, this system acts as a central hub for all administrative activities. Built with PHP, MySQL, and Bootstrap, the interface is both responsive and user-friendly.


✨ Highlights:
- Role-based login system for admins, employees, and customers
- Dashboard overview for critical ISP metrics
- Customer and employee record management
- Payment tracking with invoice generation
- Task assignment and service tracking
- Mobile-friendly UI


🧰 Tools & Technologies:
- PHP (Backend)
- MySQL (Database)
- Bootstrap 5 (UI Framework)
- Git + GitHub
fields.resume_des:
Front-end: HTML, CSS, Bootstrap 5  
Back-end: PHP  
Database: MySQL

fields.title: Thesis on LiFi Technology
fields.tag_line: Research and prototype development of high-speed LiFi wireless communication.
fields.description:
💼 Project Name: Thesis on LiFi Technology


🔗 GitHub Repository:
 https://github.com/abdullah-md-jahid-hassan/Thesis-on-LiFi


🔎 Overview:
 This project is an in-depth research endeavor focusing on the implementation and potential of LiFi (Light Fidelity) technology for high-speed wireless communication using light waves. The study encompasses a comprehensive analysis of LiFi's advantages, challenges, and practical applications.


✨ Highlights:
- Detailed exploration of LiFi technology and its comparison with traditional wireless communication methods.
- Development of a basic LiFi communication prototype using C++.
- Performance evaluation under various environmental conditions.
- Thorough documentation of research methodologies and findings.


🧰 Tools & Technologies:
- C++ Programming Language
- Arduino UNO
- RGB LED Module
- RGB Color Sensor
- LDR (Light Dependent Resistor)
- IR LED and Photodiode
- Breadboard and Jumper Wires
fields.resume_des:
Hardware: Arduino UNO, RGB LED Module, RGB Color Sensor, LDR, Photodiode  
Programming Language: C++  
Tools: Arduino IDE

fields.title: C++ Compiler Simulation
fields.tag_line: Educational C++ compiler simulation demonstrating compilation phases.
fields.description:
⚙️ Project Name: C++ Compiler Simulation

🔗 GitHub Repository:
 https://github.com/abdullah-md-jahid-hassan/c-_compiler

🔎 Overview:
 This project is a simplified C++ compiler simulation that demonstrates the fundamental phases of compilation, including lexical analysis, syntax analysis, and code generation. It serves as an educational tool to understand how compilers process source code.

✨ Highlights:
- Implements lexical analysis to tokenize input source code.
- Performs syntax analysis using defined grammar rules.
- Generates intermediate code representations.
- Utilizes a customizable grammar file for parsing rules.

🧰 Tools & Technologies:
- C++ Programming Language

fields.title: Inflation Effect Calculator
fields.tag_line: CLI tool to calculate how inflation affects money’s future value.
fields.description:
💰 Project Name: Inflation Effect Calculator

🔗 GitHub Repository:
 https://github.com/abdullah-md-jahid-hassan/inflation_effect_calculator

🔎 Overview:
 This project is a command-line tool developed in C++ to calculate the impact of inflation on the purchasing power of money over time. It allows users to input an initial amount, an annual inflation rate, and a period to determine the adjusted value of money after the specified duration.

✨ Highlights:
- Accepts user input for amount, inflation rate, and period.
- Calculates the future value of money considering the inflation rate.
- Provides a simple and efficient way to understand the effects of inflation.

🧰 Tools & Technologies:
- C++ Programming Language

fields.tag_line: 2D animated simulation of the Honduras national flag using OpenGL.

🔗 GitHub Repository:  
https://github.com/abdullah-md-jahid-hassan/flag_of_honduras_2d_animation

🔎 Overview:  
This project visually simulates the national flag of Honduras using 2D computer graphics techniques. Implemented in C++ with OpenGL, it focuses on rendering and animating the flag with accurate proportions and symbolic design. The project serves as a strong foundation for understanding basic rendering, transformation, and color manipulation in OpenGL.

✨ Highlights:  
1. Accurate representation of the Honduras flag with stars and stripes  
2. Animation logic that simulates waving or a dynamic display

5. Great for beginners in OpenGL graphics programming  

🧰 Tools & Technologies:

- OpenGL  
- Code::Blocks

fields.title: Hospital Management System
fields.tag_line: Modular hospital database schema with ERD and SQL setup scripts.
fields.description:
💼 Project Name: Hospital Management System

🔗 GitHub Repository:
https://github.com/abdullah-md-jahid-hassan/Hospital_management_system

🔎 Overview:
A well-structured database schema is designed for managing hospital operations, including patient records, doctor information, appointments, treatments, and billing. The project provides an Entity-Relationship Diagram (ERD) and SQL scripts to set up and manage the database efficiently.

✨ Highlights:
1. Covers all major hospital management modules using normalized tables
2. Visual ERD file included to explain relationships between entities
3. SQL file to quickly set up the database schema
4. Modular and extendable schema for frontend integration
5. Lightweight and easy to deploy in any DBMS that supports SQL

🧰 Tools & Technologies:
- MySQL / PostgreSQL
- SQL
- ERD Tools

fields.title: Variable Step-Down Power Supply (1.3V–19.1V, 5A Max)
fields.tag_line: 1.3V–19.1V step-down power supply with 5A output capacity.
fields.description:
🔋 Project Name: Variable Step-Down Power Supply (1.3V–19.1V, 5A Max)

🔎 Overview:
Designed a variable step-down DC power supply using a 19V, 3.25A laptop adapter as the primary source
Integrated an XL4015 buck converter module to regulate voltage output between 1.3V and 19.1V
Equipped with a Schottky diode for reverse polarity protection and safe operation
Ideal for powering development boards, sensors, and circuits during prototyping and testing

✨ Highlights:
- Output voltage range: 1.3V to 19.1V
- Current capacity: Up to 5A based on the module's capability
- Efficient voltage regulation using the XL4015 converter
- Reliable and compact design with heat dissipation support
- Suitable for electronics labs, DIY projects, and test benches

🧰 Tools & Technologies:
- XL4015 DC-DC Buck Converter Module
- Schottky Diode for reverse protection
- 19V 3.25A Laptop Power Adapter
- Standard DC Barrel Connector
- Testing tools: Heat sink, multimeter, load tester

fields.title: 12V Li-ion Battery Pack (3S4P, 18650 Cells)
fields.tag_line: 12V 3S4P Li-ion battery pack with BMS and voltage display.
fields.description:
🔋 Project Name: 12V Li-ion Battery Pack (3S4P, 18650 Cells)

🔎 Overview:
Built a 12V rechargeable Li-ion battery pack using twelve 18650 cells configured in a 3S4P arrangement.
Integrated with a 40A BMS (Battery Management System) for overcharge, over-discharge, and short-circuit protection.
Features a digital voltage meter with a push-button trigger for on-demand voltage display, and dual female DC connectors for safe input/output handling.
Ideal for powering portable electronics, DIY robotics, and off-grid devices.

✨ Highlights:
- Configuration: 3S4P (12x 18650 cells)
- Total output: ~12.6V fully charged, ~11.1V nominal
- Integrated 40A BMS for safe charging/discharging
- Onboard push-button voltmeter for live monitoring
- Dual DC jacks: separate ports for input charging and output load
- Compact and enclosed with a handmade custom case

🧰 Tools & Technologies:
- 18650 Li-ion Batteries (3.7V, 2600mAh typical)
- 3S 40A BMS Module
- Digital Voltmeter Module with Push Button
- DC Barrel Connectors (female)
- Soldering Tools, Multimeter, Hot Glue, Custom Enclosure Materials

fields.title: Personal Assets Management System
fields.tag_line: Track assets, income, zakat, and taxes with a Django-based personal finance manager.
fields.description:
💼 Project Name: Personal Assets Management System

🔗 GitHub Repository:
https://github.com/abdullah-md-jahid-hassan/Personal_assets_management

🔗 Live On:
(Not yet deployed)

🔎 Overview:
This is a Django-powered financial management system for individuals to track income, assets, taxes, and zakat. It includes role-based access (admin/user) and allows document uploads to support each record. The system is tailored to Islamic finance principles, offering automatic zakat and tax calculations based on asset and income records.

✨ Highlights:
1. Tracks multiple income sources: salary, business, investment
2. Records asset types: land, tangible (e.g. gold), and shares
3. Calculates zakat based on nisab and zakatable assets
4. Admin and user dashboards with data summaries
5. Uploadable proof/documents for all entities
6. Due date alerts for tax/zakat payments
7. Fully built with Django, HTML/CSS, and MySQL

🧰 Tools & Technologies:
- Python (Django Framework)
- MySQL (Database)
- HTML5 & CSS3 (Frontend)
- Git + GitHub
fields.resume_des:
Front-end: HTML5, CSS3  
Back-end: Python (Django)  
Database: MySQL

fields.name: General Porous
fields.summary: Motivated and detail-oriented Computer Science Engineering graduate with a strong foundation in software development. Proficient in C, C++, Java, C#, and PHP, with hands-on experience in full-stack development through an ISP system project using HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, PHP, and MySQL. Currently enhancing skills in Python and Django by working on real-world projects. A fast learner with a problem-solving mindset, highly organized, and eager to contribute technical expertise in a dynamic work environment.
